title: The Hidden Heresy Behind  "Justice."
description:
Black Liberation Theology is another piece of the social justice puzzle that is disturbing and fascinating. When sermons focus more on resistance than repentance, somethingâ€™s off. People may not recognize Black Liberation Theology by name, but the worldview seeps in through sermons, social media, â€œwokeâ€ activism, and justice movements within the church. I had an incident happen in the summer of 2025 that caused me to see the race issue in 4K, and I don't think I'll ever be the same after it. I mean that in a good way. Because it's caused me to understand a few things. First, the race and social justice warriors aren't going anywhere. We must stand firm and prepare ourselves. Second, too many Christians think they're doing the right and biblical thing by promoting Critical Race Theory and staying in Black Liberation churches. Theyâ€™ve started fighting the wrong battle. Focusing on systems instead of sin, activism instead of repentance.

No, Iâ€™m not talking about the Woke Left. 
Iâ€™m talking about the Woke Right. Or as some have appropriately put it: The Woke â€œReich.â€

In my longest interview yet, I brought on my friend Will Spencer, a former New Ager who was also pulled into this world of woke-right propaganda. 

To understand the woke right, you have to understand that their worldview begins with: â€œthe Jews are to blame for everything, and the Post World War 2 consensus is nothing more than a massive cover-up designed to protect them.â€ From there, every modern problem becomes a conspiracy: media, banks, academia, culture, medicine, even Pearl Harbor and 9/11. description:

title: Frank Turek: Inside the Berkeley Chaos, Antifa & Free Speech
description:
My friend Dr. Frank Turek has been through a lot the last two months. So we talk about a lot in today's video. 

We talk about his recent UC Berkeley (Or... the "Bezerkely") event that turned chaotic because of some violent activists, including Antifa, and why this kind of thing keeps happening. We get into how certain parts of progressivism seem to treat hostility as a feature, not an accident. We also discuss something called the Dunning-Kruger effect, which is why so many people online sound confident but have no idea what theyâ€™re talking about. From free speech to critical thinking, we talk about why testing claims, demanding evidence, and rejecting sensationalized conspiracy theories are more important than ever. Especially when those falsehoods have led to real threats toward Frank and others. And of course, we talk about the example of Charlie Kirk and the courage, kindness, and Christian conviction that made him such a great example to follow.

title: The Lie of Polygamy: Exposed Biblically, Logically & Ethically|with @InspiringPhilosophy
description:
Why is polygamy sorta trending, and why are people saying it's biblical? What in the nope is going on?

Polygamy shows up in the Old Testament, in Islam, in Mormonism, but I've been seeing this promoted by some Christians today, and I'm surprised to see it growing. From TLC's Sister Wives to influencers like Rich Tidwell and Rob Kowalski to Muslim polygamist circles, this whole trend concerns me. Some of their arguments are that polygamy is really Godâ€™s design for marriage. I started paying closer attention to this when a friend sent me an Instagram profile of a man who claims to be a Christian and has two wives. From there, I discovered numerous others making the same claims.

To unpack this, I invited my friend Michael Jones onto my channel. Heâ€™s addressed polygamy several times on his own platform, and together we break down the top biblical arguments polygamists use, expose the logical flaws, and look at the devastating psychological impact it has on women, children, and families. If youâ€™ve ever wondered why God regulated but never celebrated polygamy, this conversation will hopefully give you some answers.

description:

Honor Charlie Kirkâ€™s memory by thinking the way he did: not blindly believing, getting swept up in conspiracy, but following the truth through verified evidence, not what one person claims is true. Paranoia is not discernment. Confidence is not competence. Charisma is not credibility. When someone needs to be the hero, the victim, and the authority all at once, then I have a hard time believing that truth is their goal. Seems like they're after power and control. 

Also, I made this before Candace came for Allie Beth Stuckey. Can we all please take a moment to pray for her? Sheâ€™s been hit with an onslaught of unnecessary and awful hate over the last month. She doesnâ€™t deserve it. Allie has consistently been a phenomenal example of thoughtful critique, biblical love, and steady patience. With everything thatâ€™s been thrown her way, Allieâ€™s grace and composure have been a masterclass in integrity. Thatâ€™s the kind of example I wish more women would follow.
I fully expect a wave of backlash from Candaceâ€™s followers. I think thatâ€™s exactly why so many people stay silent. But I just donâ€™t care. Remember: the ones trying to bring people back to reality arenâ€™t being divisive. Itâ€™s the ones disconnected from reality who are. This is a core reason why I have such strong issues with unfounded and sensationalized conspiracy theories.

I will GLADLY take this video down and publicly repent if Candace Owens can prove, with verifiable evidence:

1. *How* TPUSA executives or associates were directly involved in Charlie Kirkâ€™s murder with specific, detailed, and corroborated facts verified by law enforcement, journalists, or court proceedings *beyond* Candace Owens' personal claims.

Simply asserting â€œI have sourcesâ€ or â€œI know people on both sidesâ€ without documentation, names, or corroboration does not count as proof *beyond* Candace Owens' personal claims.

5. That none of her public statements or implications have recklessly misled her audience, defamed innocent people, or emotionally exploited a murder case for engagement or personal branding.

Until then, everything stated in this video remains satirical opinion and commentary on publicly available information and public statements.
I genuinely hope I'm wrong.

title: When Activists Tried to Silence Her, They Exposed Themselves
description:
I saw a video the other day of progressive activists obnoxiously and aggressively silencing a 16-year-old girl because she refused to play basketball against a boy.  

It really caught my attention, and my heart just went out to this girl. The reason I want to highlight this is that these activists tried to silence this girl in the most antagonistic way, but I think their nonsense actually backfired, because it caught my attention. And now I have a good excuse to make a video about their aggressive progressive nopey nonsense ideology. 

What happened to her exposes the deeper ideology behind modern progressivism, gender activism, and cancel culture. My hope is to help you see how critical theory, toxic empathy, and the culture of victimhood have traded truth for feelings and why that should matter to Christians who care about free speech, fairness, and biblical truth.

But there's also a strong caution I want to give to Christians. There's a strange phenomenon I'm seeing as a response to the aggressive progressive nonsense, where I'm seeing people who are fighting progressives by using the same tactics. It's like a "mirrored" version of the woke left, except on the other side. This is shocking and disturbing. We *must* stay vigilant.

description:
Rachel Zwayne is probably one of the kindest women I've ever met, and I'm so glad to introduce her to you. No matter how old your kids are, modern motherhood can feel like a constant tug of war between emotions and truth, grace and discipline, calling and comparison. We get real about what it actually looks like to raise kids and follow Jesus in a culture obsessed with feelings and perfection. We talk about gentle parenting, and what seems to be the Instagram-perfect mom life, to finding peace in your God-given calling as a woman and mother. She talks a great deal about emotions and how beautiful they are, but also about where we can have some downfalls.

description:

I donâ€™t think most people have the slightest idea what they mean when they accuse someone of being a fascist. There's only one man I could think of in the midst of all of this who I thought would be able to speak into this with clarity and wisdom. And that is my professor from Southern Evangelical Seminary, Dr. Bernard Mauser. What actually *is* fascism? What are some of the ironies with this accusation? What part does free speech play? Thereâ€™s so much more to know about this, but Iâ€™m hoping this will give a broader perspective on the *real* hate that killed an innocent man, a brother in Christ, and a father. There is so much more to this conversation, but I did my best to give you some good information. Sorry for the choppy intro. I had to collect myself a few times.

title: Forgiveness Misunderstood: Is "Forgive and Forget" Biblical?
description:
I had a video plan to release today, but that was before the events of Wednesday. I think that this would be a more appropriate one to release, considering the events of this last week. I've been asked by more than one person how we should handle the topic of forgiveness with all of the stuff that's been happening. And I think that this conversation might surprise you. And help you. 

I think many would be surprised to discover that biblical forgiveness isn't what they think it is. I remember having a very specific "oh woooowwwww..." moment when I understood that there was a big difference between biblical forgiveness and what my friend Teasi Cannon calls "therapeutic forgiveness." She was wrong about this for years. So was I. I canâ€™t think of anyone better to talk about forgiveness than Teasi. Sheâ€™s walked through more hardship than most of us can imagine, not because of her own choices, but because of the sins and failures of others. Sheâ€™s had more people to forgive than anyone should. But what does forgiveness look like, exactly? Is forgive and forget biblical? What is therapeutic forgiveness, and why is it problematic? In the first half of this video, Teasi shares her story (trigger warning). In the second half, we talk about biblical forgiveness, and Teasi shares what she got wrong for all these years.

title: Iâ€™m Shocked by How Many Pastors Are Using This Deceptive Bible
description:
Sooo hereâ€™s what happened in order:
1. I saw this year's lineup for the Kenneth Copeland Southwest Believers Convention. (SWBC.) 
2. I was shocked at the leaders who were still aligning with Copeland (Bill Johnson, Creflo Dollar, Benny Hinn, etc), and I shared the lineup on social media. 
3. After I shared this, someone pointed out that Creflo Dollar uses a translation called the â€œMirror Translation.â€ 
4. ...the "what" translation? I then looked up said translation.
I.
Was.
SHOOKETH.

Turns out Creflo Dollar is just the tip of the iceberg. Many Word of Faith and Bethel leaders endorse and use this translation. This video is what I found. Hereâ€™s a quote from FranÃ§ois du Toit, the creator of the Mirror that expresses the heart behind his paraphrase:

â€œThe mission of Jesus was not to begin the Christian religion but to reveal and redeem the image and likeness of God in human form. He did not come as an example for us but of us. Much of popular Christian doctrine reduce the life and teaching of Jesus to yet another â€˜display-windowâ€™ message, while the very intent of God was to uncover the blueprint life of our design in Christ as in a mirror, where he is introduced to us not as Christ in history, or Christ in outer space, nor even as Christ in a future event, but as Christ in you!â€

Wow, a translation that teaches a different Gospel and says that youâ€™re divine? Sounds like a bunch of theological nopey nonsense to me. And too many leaders are teaching this nonsense to others.

title: Robert Schuller and the Movement that Rebranded Church: A Deep Dive
description:
Even if you've never heard of him, Robert H Schullerâ€™s influence has a long shadow that reaches into some of the most influential and popular pulpits today. Schullerâ€™s theology blended biblical language with self-help psychology and New Thought metaphysics, all while being a part of the RCA (The Reformed Church in America.) Not many Christians know that he was also basically the Godfather of the Seeker Sensitive movement. In this deep dive, Iâ€™m unpacking who he was, what he taught, and why it matters. I will also be giving an analysis of the seeker-sensitive movement. 

I sat on the research for this video for a while. This is the longest deep dive I've done so far, and some might find it controversial. A lot of work goes into these deep dives, and I enjoy the research. But I always want to make sure that I am doing my best to give the information with fairness and integrity, but also with boldness and firmness. I believe I've done that. 

Timestamps: 

05:23- Part 1: Who is Robert Schuller? This will be a short biography and introduction about who Robert Schuller even is, what his accomplishments were, and what he taught. 
23:19- Part 2: Schullerâ€™s â€œSecretâ€ Theology of Possibility Thinking and his Self-Esteem Gospel, laying the foundation for his motives in church growth.
1:51:36- Part 3: The Seeker Sensitive Movement. I will go over the brief history of the secret, sensitive movement, the major players in it, the influence that Schuller had, and how we see this manifested today. 
02:17:32- Part 4: The Influence. An overlook of the prominent pastors and leaders who Schuller has directly mentored and influenced, and why this is problematic. But also why itâ€™s sort of not.
02:51:34- Part 5: The Pros and Cons of the Seeker Movement. Here I'm going give what I would consider to be firm but fair insights on the Seeker Sensitive movement and the purpose of the Church. 
03:27:34: My Conclusion and final analysis.

The Controversial Origins of the Word of Faith Movement
description:
Where did the Word of Faith movement (and its teachings) come from? I sit down with Dr. Robert Bowman Jr., whose book on the Word of Faith movement helped shape my own research for my chapter on the New Thought teachings infused in the Word of Faith movement. We discuss the tangled origins, its early teachers, and the controversial connection between E.W. Kenyon and Kenneth Hagin. I ask him about the influence of New Thought, particularly in areas like positive confession, prosperity, divine healing, and the belief in human divinity, and whether my conclusions hold up.

title: Bizarre Channeled Spirits, Jesus, & Truthâ€”A Biblical Perspective on Aaron Abke's Teachings.
description:
Aaron Abke. If you don't know the name (or how to pronounce it), I assure you that you've heard the concepts: manifestation, I AM affirmations, Christ consciousness, nonduality, the false and true self, reincarnation, channeled teachings, and much more. He has a growing platform and speaks with great confidence about the Bible, Christianity, and Jesus, but in a way that historic Christianity would label as blasphemous.

He came onto my radar a few months ago when some of you sent me some of his material, some of which made it into this video. You could tell something was off, but wanted clarity as to why. This video is my attempt to bring clarity to that confusion. In this video, Iâ€™ll break down some of Aaronâ€™s core beliefs, highlight their influences, and compare them to biblical Christianity. Iâ€™ll also include clips from his content and his recent debate with Wesley Huff to provide a clearer picture of what he teaches. This is not a personal attack, just what I consider to be an honest examination of his theology through a biblical lens. I want to help Christians, but I'm also making this video in hopes that those who have gotten caught up in these teachings can see a different perspective. Jesus warns about deception. Wouldn't it be nice to know what that deception looks like? Bad theology hurts people and makes them victims of false teaching. And this is bad theology.

title: This makes you more like Satan, not God.
This is blasphemous garbage.
Napoleon Hill Unmasked: Lies, Scams, Cults, and Occult Beliefs
description:
Few books have the potential to put Christians in a theological chokehold, quite like Think and Grow Rich by Napoleon Hill. This book is more than just a best-seller. It's the entrepreneur's gospel, the self-help holy grail, the self-improvement manifesto, and, believe it or not, the sacred scripture of a 1930s secret cult. It has influenced millions of people and celebrities all around the world, giving credit to this book and its concepts for changing their lives. There are a lot of very good and true things to say about challenging ourselves to become more motivated and successful. Thereâ€™s no doubt that Think and Grow Rich contains valuable insights about motivation and successâ€”concepts that have genuinely helped many, including Christians. But is that all there is to this man and this book? Is there more lurking behind these motivational messages? I believe the answer is an emphatic yes. By the end of this video, I hope to convince you of the deeper, more complex reality behind the man and the message. 

It took me months to put this video together. To prepare, I re-read Think and Grow Rich, watched the film adaptation (yes, thatâ€™s a thing), and followed the Napoleon Hill Institute on Instagram, engaging with their content regularly. I dove into Hillâ€™s other works, consumed documentaries and videos about him, and I was also an avid follower of the New Thought beliefs held by Napoleon Hill, so I see him and this book with different eyes. 

I think it's either crazy or awesome (or both) that you all like staring at a screen, listening to my face talk for over two hours. It takes a LOT of work, sometimes months, to put these videos together. So thanks for being crazy awesome.

title: The Sneaky Spirituality Thatâ€™s Duping Christians Today
description:
From Richard Rohr, Pete Holmes, Billy Carson, and Aaron Abke, Christian mysticism is very popular. But what exactly *is* Christian "mysticism"? 

Mysticism can be challenging to define, but at its core, it's about seeking a personal, spiritual connection with the divine. Is this concept entirely unbiblical? After all, don't we all desire a personal relationship with God? The answer isn't as straightforward as it might seem. It's not that simple. In this video, I share an interview that I did with my friend Greg Hyde from @thinkingtoinfinity where we delve into this topic. (Also, keep your eye out for the very hard-to-miss...uh, creative... way he fixed some tech issues.)

title: How to Disagree Without Destroying Relationships|With Dr. Sean McDowell
description:
When was the last time you had a conversation where you disagreed with someone... and it was respectful? 

If there's one thing my good friend Dr. Sean McDowell is passionate about, it's this: how to have productive and respectful conversations with those we disagree with. In the past, this is why I adored apologetics so much. Two people would passionately debate a topic, then set their differences aside with a high five, go to dinner together, and even share pictures of their kids. That kind of camaraderie feels rare today. Many people might fear being "canceled" by their "tribe" or criticized for associating with someone who holds opposing views. Perhaps this shift is because so many spiritual topics have become emotionally charged and unnecessarily divisive. We all sense this tension. And we all feel it. So let's talk about it.

This is about something biggerâ€”a set of beliefs that isn't going anywhere and I promise you at some point in your Christian walk, you'll be confronted with these arguments and beliefs this panel puts forth. title: A heartfelt plea to leaders who call themselves "prophets."
description:
Iâ€™m sorta putting my hand in the fire with these topics. But my love for God and people compels me to speak. 

I love God. I love my country. I love (correct) prophecy. And I love truth. Many people can use current events to bolster their spiritual image. Sometimes you don't need the power of prophecy to foresee what's going to happen. If you make a prophecy about the election (or anything else with similar outcomes), it's a 50-50 chance that you are going to be right, and then take credit for it, solidifying the belief that you are indeed a prophet and people need to believe you. This is still prophecy darts, and it is rather silly to make a prediction like this, in my opinion. The only consequence, if you are right, doesn't really have anything to do with glorifying God but instead brings attention to the "prophet."

Even though I made this video before the events of July 13th, my point still stands: I'm not trying to "debunk" prophecy. A lot of times, prophecy is used to bring attention to God and spread the Gospel. My issue is whenever people misuse prophecy to bring attention to themselves and gain power. The question to ask: Who is this really glorifying?

01:20- Plea #1- Don't shame people for testing you. 
03:02- Plea #2- Be specific.
04:53- Plea #3- Take responsibility when you're wrong.
07:27- Plea #4- Think how this affects others.
09:01- Plea #5- Check your bias. (*see pinned comment.)
09:50- Plea #6- Know this brings division.
12:07- Plea #7- Know my intentions.

title: The Controversial World of MLM's... And What Nobody is Talking About.
description:
In this video, we delve into the world of MLMs (Multi-Level Marketing Companies) and explore their allure and controversy. And let me tell you... MLMs can be one of the strangest and most intriguing phenomena in the business world. I never intended this video to be as long as it did. But the more research I did, the more I decided that I needed to cover.  It took me many, many hours and almost 2 months to do this research. 

I have yet to see MLMs addressed from a Christian perspective. The *real* fuel for why I did this deep dive has to do with my background in New Thought and what I started noticing hidden within MLMs that needs to be talked about. (And it's not New Age.) I'm calling this the "dirty secret of MLMs." 

My goal is to approach this with fairness but also firmness. I think thereâ€™s generally a lot of (understandable) anger and bitterness with some of the anti-MLM crowd, and I wanted to approach this from a different angle. I made this video with no resentments but with a genuine interest in the topic, your stories, and a love for people and truth. I actually had a really wholesome experience doing this research. 

My view on MLMs might evolve as time goes on. But this is where I currently stand with MLMs. Thank you all for your help with this.

And thank you to my friend Phoenix Hayes for helping edit, especially the parts where I had to do a voiceover ğŸ«¶

Former MLM Leaders Share Why They Left it All: https://youtu.be/NUTAIkf5Fi4

Want to know more about New Thought? I wrote a book about it: https://amzn.to/3As8wTk

title: The scary drawbacks of Artificial Intelligence and why its existence has spiritual implications.
Christian vs Atheist: If There is No God, Morality is Just Your Opinion.
description:
I remember coming across this debate over a decade ago. I found it fascinating. Here are two parts of the debate that I found very eye-opening. Richard Dawkins recently said he considers himself a cultural Christian. This is a stunning admission. What would make him consider this now? I think it has a lot to do with objective morality. 

The debate can seem very forward at times, but debates like this give me hope that we all can still come together and freely talk about tough topics without being silenced. Notice the logical conclusions of both worldviews and how Frank simply asking David to explain his position was enough to show how incoherent it is. 

This is a good example of the logical conclusion we fall into if there is no God: power rules morality and *truth*. I added subtitles and a little "flair" to this video version.

title: This tricky teaching uses Christian terms.... but isn't what Jesus taught.
Those Who've Never Heard of Jesus, Damage of Seeker-Friendly Church Models & Church Hurt |Q&A Part 8
description:
You asked things. I did my best to answer the things. 

Timestamps: 
00:19- Question 1:  Should we pray to Jesus or to the Father? Or to either? 
01:10- Question 2: Do you think it is ok as a Christian to use they/them pronouns for a friend? Do you think if Christians do comply with using preferred pronouns that it would be enabling them?
03:50- Question 3: Are Christians the only people who please God? Are they the only ones who are going to be saved? What about the people who existed before Judaism who didn't know Jesus? What is the criteria for salvation? 
14:10- Question 4: Should all churches provide some form of equipping in the word to those who want it?Â Or is this the job of small groups? While our church does not teach false doctrines, since we are not equipped in how to study the word for ourselves, many members of the church are following false Gospels. Inside our groups most of what we find is life issues and self-help books from the perspective of questionable teachers. What is the role of the church an the congregants?
24:10- Question 5: I feel like I may being led to start re-evangelizingÂ  people who used to go to church.Â  I am wondering if you can point me in the right direction for helping those who were hurt by the Church, or are mad at God.

Uncovering the Evidence for the Soul: The Logical and Biblical Arguments That May Change Everything
description:
You think you might know about the soul, especially if you're a Christian. But I promise you, there's more to this doctrine than you think. I invited my friend Eric Hernandez on to talk about the soul. He gives philosophical and biblical reasons why a soul must exist. Heads up, this is a very nerdy but fascinating interview. I learned a lot and I know you will too. 

Eric Hernandez is a dynamic, young evangelistic and apologetically inclined preacher who has a passion for defending his faith on both theological and philosophical grounds. He is a licensed minister, certified formation therapist and currently teaches at Magdiel Bible Institute.

Timestamps:
00:00- Who is Eric and his story about how an atheist professor got him interested in this topic.
08:50- Beginning of the Philisophical/Logical argument for the soul. 
10:31- What is a soul?
13:42- Law of Identity.
18:35- Substance Dualism, a fancy word for, "I am a soul that has a brain and body."
20:53- Aggregates, a fancy word for asking, "are we just physical?"
26:51- Indivisibility of Personhood, a fancy word for saying we can't divide personhood. (Great logical argument against abortion, btw.)
29:42- The Biblical Argument for the Soul
33:24- An interesting perspective on the Sadducees and Jesus' view of the resurrection. (My favorite part.)
44:23- Which is right?: Dichotomy (body and soul) and trichotomy (body, soul and spirit) 
55:15- Eric's view on if animals have souls?

ğŸ‘€WATCHğŸ‘€:

title: Theonomy, Humanism and the Moral Law| with Dr. Frank Turek
description:
In my continuing research about Critical Theory, postmodernism, the sexual revolution, and the gender ideology plowing through the world, I came across a book in my seminary class that was a huge eye-opener for me. title: New Age in the Church. #shorts
Deepak Chopra Meets Greg Koukl: THIS is How You Defend Christianity
description:
Deepak Chopra, a very well-known New Age teacher of mysticism debates Christian apologist Greg Koukl on Lee Strobel's show "Faith under Fire." This interaction was mentioned in the forward to Greg's book, "Tactics."

Though this aired in 2005, I think it's still one of the best examples of how to effectively deliver facts while calling out inconsistencies in your opponent's position. Notice how Dr. Chopra begins stating information with certainty, only to default to "uncertainty" at the end, a very popular (and wildly inconsistent) position many New Agers hold. Many progressive Christians have a similar view, interestingly. 

What's startling is that Deepak Chopra has written several books about "Jesus" and he's not able to take Greg's challenges and corrections head-on. I think this is an excellent resource for students, too, to show logical fallacies. I added subtitles and a little "flair" to this video version.

title: The Warning Christians Critically Need: Bethel, New Age, and the New Apostolic Reformation.
description:
The New Apostolic Reformation (NAR) is a popular and fast-growing new movement of Christians who emphasize signs and wonders and teach that God is giving a new revelation through new apostles and prophets. But is this biblical Christianity? This stuff used to be fringe. Now it's probably in your church in some way. Why is this dangerous, and how can you spot it? I talk with Holly Pivec and Doug Geivett, the authors of Counterfeit Kingdom, about this concerning movement.

title: The Time When I Looked for Kids Books About Puberty Blockers
description:
This is a smart(er) girl's guide for what you need to know about this book. The transgender train keeps plowing through our lives in every way possible, and the latest to cave to its ideology is American Girl. Iâ€™ve bought American Girl books for my own daughters and really loved them. So I knew I had to get my hands on it when I heard that they released a body image book that not only teaches girls that they can choose their gender identity and talks about puberty blockers, but it also has CRT. 
I thought it was available in stores, so I went to look for it. But what it turned into was me going around my city to different libraries and bookstores to go on a hunt to seek out other books that are teaching this stuff to our kids. title: This isn't what you think it means.
description:
John 14:12 says: "Very truly I tell you, whoever believes in me will do the works I have been doing, and they will do even greater things than these, because I am going to the Father."

Does this verse teach that we will do greater miracles, wonders, and signs than Jesus did? If so, then why don't we see this? Is it even possible that any human being can do anything greater than God in the flesh did? A common misinterpretation by many hyper-charismatic leaders is that we are indeed to do more than Jesus did. But there are logical and theological issues with this. Mike does a good job bringing clarity to this verse.

title: Hell: Unfair and Barbaric or Just and Deserved?
description:
What's up with the doctrine of Hell? Many Christians struggle with this concept. Jesus clearly talks about it, and it seems to be a logical end if God is Just. But even then, many people still have questions about it. When I was in the New Age, I believed that pretty much everyone would eventually make it to heaven. I interviewed Clay Jones about annihilationism, universalism, how Hell makes sense with a loving God, and much more. 

Clay Jones is a visiting scholar at Talbot School of Theology and chairman of the board at Ratio Christi. He holds a Doctor of Ministry from Trinity Evangelical Divinity School.Â

title: A Change in Identity: Lost in LGBTQ... Found in Christ.
description:
This is the story of Becket Cook. He was a gay man in Hollywood who had quite a successful career. He gave up everything to follow Jesus. It all started with a fateful event in a coffee shop... In this video, we discuss how this happened and how he overcame common objections to what the Bible says about homosexuality. We also discuss Christians going to gay weddings, Progressive Christianity's unbiblical (and unhelpful) stance on this topic, do's and don'ts when someone comes out, and much more. Our goal is to talk about these topics in a loving but firm way in a culture that is hostile to a Biblical perspective on sexuality.

title: If There is no Free Speech, There is no Real Thought.
description:
We're finding more and more people embracing blatant lies thinking it's the high moral ground. As language becomes less expressive, minds are more easily controlled. Apathy makes people prefer the false peace of conformity to the tensions of liberty. Whatever and whoever has the power can pressure you into believing their version of truth.... even if they're flat-out lies. Anyone who opposes this is viewed as backward and ignorant. We live in a world where there is more and more intense social pressure to accept that there is no such thing as objective truth. There's only power. Whoever holds the power decides what is true and false. The value of truth claims depends on who's making them. More and more people are knowingly believing lies out of fear of opposing them. 
In possibly one of my favorite interviews I've done so far, Greg Koukl from Stand to Reason addresses free speech and what this really means.

title: Will Everyone Eventually go to Heaven?
description:
The belief in Universalism has become more popular in recent years. In almost every era of the Christian church, professing Christians have found the idea of universalism attractive. It has been condemned in the history of the church, almost from the beginning. And it comes up every generation to be debated. 
A helpful analogy: Say we're sick and have cancer. We want to get better. So we look into medicine to help us. We might have people who want to help us and give us suggestions on how to get better. It might be that someone is telling you not to go to the doctor at all! Go holistic. Someone else says you need a vacation. Less stress cures cancer! Someone else might say you must get chemo and go to the doctor. Another might say you must get meds off the black market to live. Another will say that you must meditate and use crystals. Another says NO, you must use oils and practice a very clean diet. Another says, just pray with nothing else. And yet another says you must take illegal drugs to live and get better. The question is: which one will cure my cancer? Which one will actually help?
Imagine for a second that someone walks into the room and says, "you know what? They ALL cure your cancer. Doesn't matter which one you do or take. Just pick any one of those solutions and you'll be okay."
What you'll probably end up doing is the easiest one! But the worst person in the room is the dude telling you that every one of these will work. They have almost guaranteed that you won't pick a hard path to a cure. "Don't worry... you'll be fine in the end no matter what you do!" Taken to a spiritual level, Universalism is a bad cure. If it's not true, and all paths don't lead to God, then you're leading them... where?

title: Don't Just "Feel" Your Faith: Understand and Defend it.
description:
What do we do when "just have faith" isn't enough? What makes Christianity different from other religions? Does your affiliation with Christianity feel more like an accident than an informed decision? I sat down with J.Warner Wallace to talk about one of my favorite books he's written (... okay probably my most favorite...) about what it means to have what he calls a "forensic faith". We attempt to make a case for why we even need to make a case for Christianity, an apologetic for apologetics. One reason why I really fell in love with apologetics so long ago was that it satisfied a deep need for a more rich, robust, and *full* faith that didn't just rely on my subjective experience or what I felt was true. Literally, anyone of any belief system can have that. But Christianity? Was there evidence for this? Could I fall back on what was objectively true when feelings ultimately failed? Should I shelve my doubts entirely and ignore them or can I face them head-on and ask questions and honestly wrestle with Scripture to draw a deeper and more powerful reason for why I believe what I do? Answer: Yes. 

Where to purchase Forensic Faith: https://www.amazon.com/Forensic-Faith-Detective-Reasonable-Evidential/dp/1434709884/ref=sr_1_1?crid=3RKX406U7AK0&keywords=forensic+faith&qid=1650659644&sprefix=forensic+faith%2Caps%2C144&sr=8-1

title: "Reap What You Sow" - What the Bible Really Says
description:
Galatians 6: 7-8 says  "Do not be deceived: God cannot be mocked. A man reaps what he sows. Whoever sows to please their flesh, from the flesh will reap destruction; whoever sows to please the Spirit, from the Spirit will reap eternal life."

Sounds straightforward, but "sowing a seed" has a very different meaning in many Word of Faith churches and from their teachers. In the New Age, I remember learning about the supposed spiritual laws of the universe, and one of those laws was the "Law of Sowing," which is strikingly similar (if not directly the same, with some verbiage exceptions) to what many prosperity teachers preach about "sowing" into your life. The idea was whatever you "sowed" in the physical and spiritual realm would manifest itself to you. If you sowed a seed of money, you reaped money. If you sowed a seed of happiness, you'd reap happiness, and so on and so forth. It was a way to manifest prosperity. (And this was before I knew there were people in the CHURCH teaching these things!) This Scripture is just one of many misused to support this bad theology. 

What does this scripture actually mean?
Mike Winger helps break down scriptures sometimes misused by the New Age and Prosperity Preachers and corrects a common misunderstanding about biblical prosperity and the context of these verses.

Also, in my screen recording in the beginning of the video, I couldn't help myself but share out loud what I thought of Duplantis' teaching. I forgot that screen recording on my Mac also picks up on outside sounds. My comment was too appropriate to edit out. So I left it in. #SorryNotSorry

title: In Christ Alone: Glow in the Dark Painting
description:
I had THE most fun doing this painting. Everything about it, from beginning to end was a total blessing. 

For those that aren't aware, I do a painting around this time of year to celebrate the resurrection, the very event that transformed the world and defines our Christian faith. Every year on Passion week my family watches Pilgrims Progress and American Gospel. In particular, the song choice for this painting and crown of thorns is a nod to American Gospel 2: Christ Crucified, where the atonement is passionately defended. I've had the idea for this painting since watching it for the first time. 

"In Christ alone who took on flesh
Fullness of God in helpless babe
This gift of love and righteousness
Scorned by the ones He came to save
Till on that cross as Jesus died
The wrath of God was satisfied
For every sin on Him was laid
Here in the death of Christ I live."

And there is salvation in no one else, for there is no other name under heaven given among men by which we must be saved.- Acts 4:12

Fun facts:
1.) The crown of thorns in the beginning was a last-minute thing when I planned the painting. I was just going to paint the whole Canvas black but then I decided that it might be fun to do a negative space image and just paint over it. 
2.) Painting with my hands was unplanned as well. It's a good day when there's paint on my hands! Plus it is easier to maneuver the paint that way.
3.) This is my first time ever using glow in the dark paint and it's really fun!
4.) The song is by Shane and Shane and is very purposely chosen to connect the idea of the painting. There are two versions of the song and I edited them both together. 
5.) The splatter of the stars was my favorite part. 
6.) The mess on my hands can be symbolic of the message of the painting with the song: We're dirty. He cleanses us. 
7.) The last image of the video says it all.

I hope this blesses you as much as it was a blessing to make!

title: Untamed: Becoming a Slave to Your Own Passions
description:
I invited my friend Alisa Childers on my channel to have a conversation about the book "Untamed" by Glennon Doyle. This is a very popular (and trendy) book that has enchanted millions of people. Published in 2020, it's a memoir of Glennon Doyle. One reviewer describes the book in this way: "This testament to female empowerment and self-love, with an endearing coming-out story at the center, will delight readers." 

So yeeeaahhh... self-help. The scary patriarchy. Radical feminism. White supremacy. Oppressed by religion. Not to mention the Progressive/New Age spirituality scattered throughout the book. With a book so relevant and popular, not just culturally but spiritually, I just had to give my thoughts about it. There was no better person to do that with than Alisa Childers. 

Hey... Doyle wants us to go untamed, so we decided to take her advice. We weren't tamed in our review. Roar.

title: Do We Practice "Me-ology" Or "Theology"?
description:
I talked with my friend and fellow apologist Shanda Fulbright from the "Her Faith Inspires" Podcast about growing up in a church atmosphere that was focused more on extreme emotionalism than the Bible and theological truths. Emotions and feelings are good things and can be wonderful to experience. But what happens when we start to rely on them as our basis for truth? What happens when what we're feeling is our litmus test for our relationship with God? title: How Christians can Faithfully Fight the Aggressive Seduction of Secularism
description:
What in the crazy is happening in the world? The pressure Christians are under to buckle and give in to this ever-growing secular culture is unlike what we've seen in most of our lifetimes. How can we navigate through the cultural mess when there are so many loud voices in our faces pressuring us to compromise our values and God, and if we don't, then we're seen as bigoted, hateful, and close-minded? (Not to mention it's ten times harder to know we've even been seduced when most Christians don't read or study their Bibles.) We're ridiculed for standing for truth that corresponds to reality. Christians are accused of having the worst possible motives when we simply believe that there's a reason to live for truth, justice, and love from a Biblical perspective. How can we remain faithful in a culture that is becoming more and more aggressively hostile to the Christian faith? Here is one lifeline: This book.

There are a few books on my shelf that are marked up and tabbed. I refer to these books often. This is one of them. This is one of the best books I've read about this topic, and possibly Natasha's best book she's written yet. (Which is saying something!) Reading Natasha's book was refreshing, thought-provoking and encouraging.

title: The Time a Christian Visited a Jehovah's Witness Kingdom Hall
description:
In my early days of ministry, waaaaay before the Tubes of You, I used to frequent many events that surrounded the Jehovah's Witness religion. One thing I'd do is visit their Kingdom Hall. This is different from the time I went to visit a psychic. My theology wasn't a metaphysical mess this time. This was a very educational and fruitful time for me, and to the best of my memory, I want to share what my first visit was like. I wanted to respect the privacy of the women I attended the Kingdom Hall with, so I didn't mention them by name or give details about their lives. There's no way they'd ever have gone to church with me, because to them our churches are worldly, of the devil. Me going to them led to many very Gospel-centered conversations and thoughtful challenges to their beliefs that I was able to put forth that I otherwise wouldn't have had an opportunity to do. 

*I want to be clear and say that I'm not saying that every Christian needs to go visit a Kingdom Hall, especially someone that is new in the faith or isn't equipped to enter into that kind of situation. I was ready, willing, equipped, and knew exactly what I was walking into and did it for good reasons and it ended up being a very fruitful thing for me with sharing the Gospel effectively with JWâ€™s. This was the very roots of my ministry. I like to revisit this time in my life often to remind myself that there are people that are in the bondage of strict legalistic religion and know nothing of the love of God. They are stuck with rigid religious rules that they'll never be able to follow, and itâ€™s a reminder to me of the power of the Gospel and that Jesus can indeed free them from their bondage. 

0:00- Intro and Thoughts on Why I Did This
03:51- Beginning of Video

title: God is Love or Love is God?: How Progressive Christians and New Agers Have it Wrong
description:
1 John 4:16-18 says: "So we have come to know and to believe the love that God has for us. God is love, and whoever abides in love abides in God, and God abides in him. By this is love perfected with us, so that we may have confidence for the day of judgment, because as he is so also are we in this world. There is no fear in love, but perfect love casts out fear. For fear has to do with punishment, and whoever fears has not been perfected in love."

This scripture (and many others) I saw misused to promote a type of unbalanced spiritual love that was seen as a sort of 'power'. Love was a frequency, a vibration, that was obtained by how you felt and what you thought. The enemy to love was fear and judgment. There were many times that I was told things like, "God is love! There's no fear in love. Look! It's even in the Bible!" and this scripture among many others was shown to me to make it seem that this is what Jesus taught and what these new thought/new age teachers taught was indeed correct. 

But are they?

Mike Winger helps break down another scripture sometimes misused by the New Age and Progressive Christians and corrects a common misunderstanding about biblical love.

title: The Five Most Illogical People You Meet on the Internet
description:
Believe me... there are more than just five. 

Emma is just trying to post an article to her blog. The title of the article is â€œWhy I Believe God Existsâ€ and gives evidence for her position. She just hopes that people will read it and give quality feedback and intelligent arguments, is that too much to ask? But when sheâ€™s about to post it, the essences of online logical fallacies show up. Get the popcorn ready!

This is a million.5x45+300 divided by a purple potato times infinity percent- Alisa Childer's idea. This entire concept and idea was hers and is based on her article "The 5 Most Illogical People You Will Meet on the Internet." Super shoutout to her for letting me run with this article and idea. Your FACE is amazing!

Meet Red Herring- The logical fallacy that LOVES to change the subject to take the focus off of the actual point. Called a 'Red Herring' as a visual for a strong-smelling fish used to throw hounds off the scent, when someone is guilty of this fallacy, they are changing the subject, using irrelevant information to distract you, sending you down a rabbit trail you never intended. (Points to you if you can guess what Red's earrings are made out of!)

Meet Character Assassinator/Ad Hominem- The logical fallacy that we see all too often that attacks the person and their shortcomings instead of discussing the actual argument. They love to name-call and accuse rather than actually face the real argument.

Meet Self-Defeater- If they only knew how they sounded... This is someone who defeats their own position... BY their own position! The kicker? They don't even realize it. This fallacy fails to meet its own standard and cannot live up to its own criteria. (Shout-out to my 7-year old for letting me destroy her headband with a cheap arrow and to our pet chickens for lending some feathers. You a real one.)

Meet Strawman- This fallacy just loves to misrepresent others' arguments because they're easier to attack than the real one. They end up arguing against a false or distorted version of the argument rather than the argument itself.

Meet Gish Galloper- This fallacy is truly a magician of words, flamethrowing objections, questions, and arguments to overwhelm you, making it impossible to actually combat each argument in a reasonable amount of time. Giddy up. They have a false superiority of their position as a result. (Gish and Red are basically besties.)

Alisa Childers article: 
https://www.alisachilders.com/blog/the-5-most-illogical-people-you-will-meet-on-the-internet

description:

title: For the Empty, Lost and Forgotten: What True Victory REALLY Looks Like
description:
For the last few years for Resurrection Sunday (Easter), I've done a painting. I only started really incorporating these pieces on my channel in some way. I have had this idea and concept for a painting for a *long* time. I finally was able to make it all come together this year. No other time of year do I hold closer to my heart as a Christian than when we celebrate the Resurrection. 

Guys... God became a man.

GOD became a MAN. He became His own creation to pay the just penalty for sin that we could never pay. He took our place, the righteous for the unrighteous. *This* is the atonement. I mean... wow. "For our sake he made him to be sin who knew no sin, so that in him we might become the righteousness of God."- 2 Corinthians 5:21.

I filmed this with three different cameras, over six hours of footage. The editing itself was a total rollercoaster, wild and unpredictable. To me, the video is just as much art as the painting itself. I hope you all enjoy it. I worked very hard on it.

title: The Attributes of God... and Why I Believe They Mean God Must Be a Trinity
description:
For a while now Iâ€™ve been wanting to cover this topic about Godâ€™s attributes, and in my study of putting together this video, I discovered that this is also a *great* way to show the validity, perfection, and necessity of God being a Trinity, particularly in Godâ€™s love. I think a lot of unbelievers-and even believers- think they know who God is and how He functions. But so many things are completely misunderstood about God because they misunderstand who He is in His glory and completeness, mainly, they misunderstand the Attributes of the Christian God. Who is He? What makes Him so unique and set apart? All throughout Scripture He sets Himself apart from all other false gods and anything people could possibly imagine in creation. I think if the attributes of God were understood better then people would have a much better understanding of how God interacts with the world and why He does it in the manner in which He does and why it's so believable that God doesn't *need* anything from humanity... because He's completeness perfected!

title: "You are gods..." What Did Jesus Mean?
description:
In my opinion, one of the most misunderstood passages in the gospels is in John 10:33-36 when Jesus is talking to the Pharisees. It says, â€œWe are not stoning you for any good work,â€ they replied, â€œbut for blasphemy, because you, a mere man, claim to be God.â€ Jesus answered them, â€œIs it not written in your Law, â€˜I have said you are â€œgodsâ€â€™? If he called them â€˜gods,â€™ to whom the word of God cameâ€”and Scripture cannot be set asideâ€” what about the one whom the Father set apart as his very own and sent into the world? Why then do you accuse me of blasphemy because I said, â€˜I am Godâ€™s Sonâ€™?"

What did Jesus mean when he said the phrase, "you are gods"? Many people claim this is a verse saying that humans were meant to be gods, but this is against everything Jesus and Scripture stood for. Pastor Mike helps bring clarity. 

We both understand there are different understandings of this passage. I'd recommend checking out Dr. Michael Heiser's research about this as well.

title: Thoughts on Baptism and Why Christians do it
description:
Salvation and water baptism are a lot like marriage. Itâ€™s not the wedding ring that makes you married, right? Itâ€™s the inner commitment and the vows that you take. Accepting Jesus as Lord and committing your life to Him, is like the wedding vows, the commitment that comes from within.
The water baptism is like putting on the wedding ring. You want people to know that youâ€™re married. Itâ€™s a public testimony to where your loyalties lie.
I believe both the inner and outward commitment is important, based on what the Bible tells about both.

I'm aware there is an element of intelligent discussion among many of my respected brothers and sisters in Christ about this topic, especially depending on their denomination. I'm not going to hash all this out here in this video but just wanted to make a short thoughtful video about the beauty of baptism. I'm sure we, as the Bride of Christ, can handle these thoughtful disagreements in the comments section. Because...

title: If a 1st Century Christian Had a Conversation with Your Average 2021 Christian
description:

title: When Lies Become "Truth" and the Monsters it Makes Us.
description:
Heads up... Dense conversation ahead.
You've been warned. 

What do you do when suddenly everything in your culture gets turned around? We're finding more and more people embracing blatant lies thinking it's the high moral ground. As language becomes less expressive, minds are more easily controlled. Wrong is right. Right is wrong. Up is down. Down is up. Babies in the womb aren't actually babies. Men have periods. Men are women. Women are men. At the same time... there are no men or women. Gender is fluid. The color of your skin determines your worth and character. Never in my lifetime did I think this would be considered 'progress'. It ironically hurts more people than it helps, especially those who truly struggle with their sexual identity and those begging to be heard about true injustices. The world hurts the world to help the world. Slavery is freedom. War is peace. Love is hate. This reminds me of Orwell's "Newspeak." This is confusing.

And I think it's supposed to be.

Why?

Power.

Apathy makes people prefer the false peace of conformity to the tensions of liberty. Whatever and whoever has the power can pressure you into believing their version of truth.... even if they're flat-out lies. Anyone who opposes this is viewed as backward and ignorant. We live in a world where there is more and more intense social pressure to accept that there is no such thing as objective truth. There's only power. Whoever holds the power decides what is true and false. The value of truth claims depends on who's making them. More and more people are knowingly believing lies out of fear of opposing them. 

Personally, in a few short years, this has been in my face. It's been difficult and confusing to sort out what's happening and trying to understand it in a meaningful and accurate way. It felt messy. It's like you're trying to clean your kitchen, and can handle the regular mess of everyday life. Then suddenly, your kitchen expands ten times bigger and the mess is no longer one you're capable of handling by yourself. It's time for reinforcements who have had MUCH more experience dealing with MUCH bigger messes. 

So I handed Greg Koukl his metaphorical mop and broom. I asked Greg on to give me his thoughts on this. As I mention at the beginning of the video, I listen to his podcast, Stand to Reason, regularly.  He did one in May that really resonated with me. We discuss things like:
How do we discern truth in this divided world? Are we really entering into soft totalitarianism? What does that even mean? Are we inflating this? With such militant and intense pressure to conform, what can we do about it? And much more. 

I walked away from this conversation with a lot of the understanding, perspective, and insight that I've been craving about these topics. 

So yeah. This was an interesting interview.

Timestamps:
0:00- Intro
04:54- How Are we Entering into Soft Totalitarianism? What Even is that?
18:21- Why Freedom of Speech is Shockingly Important
26:15- The Propaganda in our Culture and how Language Persuades us to Believe Lies.
29:16- Are Only Christians Upset About this?
33:30- How People WANT to be Controlled as Long as it Makes Them Happy; Willful Apathy
37:04- What's the Natural Outcome of this if People Get What They Want?
48:17- A Nagging Candid Question About Other's Perspectives on our "Pre Totalitarian Culture"
58:29- What's the Ideal Way to Respond to Real Misinformation and Unhealthy Echo Chambers?

Links Mentioned in Interview:

title: Some Christians on the Internet These Days.
description:
The out-of-focus camera... the shoddy lighting... the mediocre acting... the very okay editing... you know what that means? Yes... another exceedingly average quality satire video! 

I introduce... Judy McJudgerson!  Think you don't know of her? I assure you... you do. You've seen them... the keyboard warriors. Always ready to call out every little thing everyone does, all in the name of Jesus. They're waiting... like virtual vultures, ready to make you their theological punching bag. If you're a new Christian? Watch out. Almost everything is a theological battle and mountains are made out of molehills. (No thanks to that pesky magnifying glass.) "No grace" is their motto, and they're some of the most toxic and angriest Christians on the internet. 

They do more damage then they realize.

-Yes, that's a real pitchfork. They really ARE in short supply. 
-The magnifying glass is my favorite thing ever.
-The reference to 2001 is me making fun of myself. I went through a 'McJudgerson' phase.
-The wig was from my Mom. She had breast cancer last year. (Yes, she beat it!) When she lost her hair she got a wig. She never wore it. 
I can see why.
-My apologies to anyone whoâ€™s coincidentally named Judy. Please donâ€™t cancel me.

title: Counterfeit Vs. Authentic: Can Christians Redeem New Age Practices?
description:
Is it true that for every counterfeit spiritual experience or practice out there, that there's an authentic one? These are teachings such as clairaudience (speaking to angels), channeling spirits, spirit guides, spell casting, trances, astrology, auras, psychic powers, or just â€˜fill in the blankâ€™ with any New Age teaching. title: Draw People to Jesus... Not Your Church.
description:
This is a short clip from a longer video discussing one of the many issues I go over in the MegaChurch model. The longer version of this video can be found here: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_0QvXOtJ58Q&t=2828s

There are churches that are huge that are growing in membership every year... Yet we see a decline of people who follow the actual Biblical standard of what defines a follower of Jesus. How can this be? Aren't there hundreds of thousands of people going to huge churches every week? When we see how the MegaChurch functions, typically we see the appeal to emotions and felt needs over actually knowing the gospel and the Bible. Under this model, there are lots of numbers and numerical growth... but we hardly ever see true repentance or spiritual growth. It's not that it doesn't happen in megachurches... it does! God can- and does- use any means to draw people to Him. Praise God for that. But when someone can go to a seeker-sensitive church for years and still not know the core doctrines of Christianity or what the Gospel really is, it might be time to bring this to the table and discuss it.

title: What is the Gospel?
description:
I can hardly believe that my channel is going to be at 100,000 subs.

I just want you guys to know that this whole channel really isn't about me at all but doing what God has gifted me to do and that's to proclaim Him and the Gospel. It's not easy, but I kind of look at this ministry like it's something that I'm stewarding and it needs to be all for God's glory and in His will. So I am in essence a servant, to serve not just Jesus but also to the Church, His people. And something that I've really been wanting to do lately is something that might seem a little weird to some people. Maybe it's because they assume that people would know this, but I actually want to make a video about the Gospel. It was Paul Washer in the American Gospel documentary that was saying that he can't just assume that the audience heâ€™s talking to actually knows the Gospel so that's what he chooses to preach on most of the time. And I also got done reading Michael Wilder's book, "Passport to Heaven", and it was deeply saturated with love for the Gospel and the search for truth and it really resonated with me. So I thought it would be appropriate for where my channel is at right now to make a video on this. Everything I do is surrounded by the Gospel, the identity of Jesus, and fighting for truth. I want everything I do in ministry to revolve around this: loving God and loving people. Praise God for letting me use my God-given gifts, whether it's art, satire, relaying theology or apologetics for Him. I'm a mixed bag. Growing up, I always thought I didn't fit in, but now I embrace the weird things about me. I am repeatedly in awe at how God uses us. Praise the Lord! 

Definitely worth watching American Gospel (and the second one!): http://www.americangospelfilm.com/

title: Is the Sinners Prayer in the Bible?
description:

Some repeat it not even knowing what it really means, what the gospel actually is, or it's some sort of 'magic formula' to get them saved. Others have said it and were very genuine in their words and belief. So... what's up with it? Is it wrong?  Is this okay to repeat then? I myself didn't say any prayer like this and I experienced salvation, while others were actually led to Christ through such a tradition. I give my thoughts on this.

title: A Candid Conversation with Dallas Jenkins, Director of The Chosen
description:
This interview is a little different. 

In this video, I interview Dallas Jenkins. Dallas is the director of The Chosen, a very popular Christian tv series that continues to grow with incredible momentum. With momentum and popularity comes controversy, and The Chosen has been no exception. In this video, Dallas and I discuss some of that controversy. We discuss his convictions, beliefs, and talk about some tough stuff too, in particular the controversy he's gotten for his association with the LDS. And yes, we spoke many times about this through email before the interview so he wasn't blindsided. This was a very mutual conversation. Much of the controversy comes from him sharing publicly that he believes that LDS and Christians believe in the 'same Jesus,' which is a salvific issue. If anyone has talked with a senior LDS or your friendly local Missionaries that knows what the LDS Church teaches and the doctrine then you'll know why this is so problematic.

For as long as this interview was, we did still discuss some of this 'tough stuff' off air as well. I'm positive there will be controversy from LDS and Christians over this, one side saying I 'misrepresent' LDS beliefs (check out the receipts below please, and if you disagree with what the LDS Church teaches... um... that's not a bad thing lol) and the other side upset that I'm simply even interviewing Dallas, or that I didn't harshly rebuke him or something. Just know that this video easily could have gone three times as long and I hope it lays a good foundation for this situation. 

Do I agree with some of Dallas's conclusions? No.
Do I lovingly challenge him on this? Yes.
Does he welcome and want these challenges? Yes. 
Do I agree with other conclusions? Yes.
Do I lovingly agree with him on these things? Yes.

This conversation hopefully will help everyone know where Dallas stands with these issues that we talked about. Please pray for Dallas and for everyone on the set of The Chosen.

title: Is Bethel's SOZO Mentally and Emotionally Damaging? Thoughts From a Mental Health Professional
description:
This video has been a long time coming. 
I sat down with my good friend Britt who's a licensed mental health professional to talk to her about SOZO, a deliverance ministry that's out of Bethel Church in Redding California. From their website, it says: "SOZO is a prophetic ministry for all-embracing healing and for deliverance from bondage. SOZO helps uncover the roots that are keeping you from living a life of freedom and fullness. In personal encounters with Jesus and through the resurrection power of the Holy Spirit, these roots are identified, removed and replaced by new life. In this way, when you receive a SOZO you can become whole and walk better in the destiny to which God has called you."

You can read from their own website more about it: https://bethelsozo.ch/what-is-sozo/

In my research of looking into this deliverance ministry, one aspect of it that I wanted to look into was the mental side... How damaging is it? What can go wrong here? She read Bethel's SOZO book with me and had *many* concerns from her perspective as not only a Christian but as someone who's in the mental health field. It's not my area of expertise, and when we sat and talked about what she thought, she made it sound much smarter than I ever could. I decided to ask her to sit and talk with me about SOZO. I plan on making a follow-up video discussing the theological implications of SOZO. Please pray for Bethel.

title: The Pendulum Problem: The Issue with Fanaticism
description:
I define the Pendulum Problem as follows: when someone takes an unhealthy extreme stance in their beliefs for the purpose of distancing themselves as much as possible from their previous beliefs that were steeped in trauma or deception. This is something I'm sure we've all experienced and witnessed. It can be difficult for someone to see the opposite point of view depending on which end of the Pendulum they're on. title: Freedom in Christ
description:
Time for another painting video :-) 

I have been painting this particular piece for many years now, but this is the first time filming it for YouTube. This was a piece that I did on a total whim one day because I was inspired after hearing testimonies of those who had left religious cults. The story of freedom made me think of someone who was free from the chains of false religion, false gospel and a false Jesus and was now in true freedom in Christ. I LOVE painting with reds and greys. There's something very powerful about a limited palette to portray a message, and red has always been a very loud and leading color. "Freedom" is the name of this painting, and it was made to portray our freedom in Christ, and the release from spiritual bondage. 

Sometimes we need to relax and remember who Jesus is and who we are in Christ. 

Behind the Painting: This took about three hours to do, and is done in oils. The only colors I used were black, white and two different kinds of red. The canvas size is 24x36.

My Tribute Painting to Ravi Zacharias: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F7Togab6lpk

title: The 'Impossible Gospel' of the New Age
description:
The New Age has its own gospel. In fact, I dare say every belief system in the world has some sort of list of what you need to do to be 'good' in the eyes of God and people. In this video, I present what I call the 'Impossible Gospel' of the New Age. Because it does, indeed, require constant works in order to obtain the salvation it offers. 

There are not many belief systems in the world. There are not thousands of religions. There are not even hundreds. There are not even a dozen. What if I told you that there were onlyâ€¦. Two? Yesâ€¦ that's it. Two. They're DO and DONE. *This* is what makes Jesus SO unique. In this video, I'm going to show how the New Age does indeed demand constant works to obtain the 'salvation' that it offers.

title: Doesn't Jesus Say Not to Judge?!
description:
Matthew 7:1- "Do not judge or you too will be judgedâ€¦" well there ya have it, folks. It has it right here in scripture to not judge. Why can't we all just be one big living coexist sticker? Doesn't Jesus here say not to judge? One of the BIGGEST things I hear after leaving the new age, and even when I was in it was how judgmental Christians were. Aren't we supposed to not judge? Isn't judging wrong? So let's break this down today. What did Jesus mean in Matthew 7 when he said, 'Do not judge?' When you actually read the Bible and get an idea of the context of not only what Jesus was saying, but the attributes of God Himself, you get some fantastic perspective on what Jesus means here and the overall Biblical perspective on how judgment works for humanity. In this video, I'm going to share four points to show that there is a biblical place for proper and improper judgment.

title: Are Affirmations Biblical? My Thoughts.
description:
I Am Worthy of making more money. I am full of positive love and positive energy. I am loved, loving, and loveable. I am becoming the best version of myself. I am enough.These are only some of the affirmations I made when I practiced the Law of Attraction as a new ager. What's wrong with these statements? Are self-affirmations like this really new age? Why? Is it wrong to say or think positive things about myself now? Am I supposed to walk around thinking what a terrible person I am because saying positive things about myself is 'new age'?These are some of the common questions I asked myself when I left the new age, and many have asked me similar questions. Honestly, many ex new agers struggle with this. 

In this video, I'm going to share Three main ideas that will help illustrate this and give biblical support to show you what I mean.

**FYI- I did have some audio/visual issues while filming this video. Towards the middle of the video, you'll notice a slight lag. I always strive to put out the best quality image and audio I can for you guys. I was a little frustrated while editing it because it was difficult to fix and debated not posting the video at all. But I thought the content was good and fixed what I could, and overall, I think it came together okay.

title: Top Five New Age Teachings in the Church
description:
New Age in the Church?! Yep. It's been going on for quite a while now. In fact, you'd be shocked to know that a lot of Christians believe in many New Age beliefs and don't even know it. I might make a part 2 to this at some point because I realize that there's a LOT of New Age practices out there. But in putting this video together, these are the top 5 deceptions that I kept thinking about that I see the most in churches today: Law of Attraction, Oneness, Religious Pluralism, Universalism, and Mysticism. description:
**This is a re-upload from April 2019.**

This was filmed at my old church by some of our wonderful production crew for Palm Sunday. 

The song that I laid over this is called the Great I AM by new Life Worship. Being an ex New Thoughter, this song has a very different meaning for me. I used to think I AM meant that *I* was God, that I could harness an inner power of divinity by affirming I AM like Jesus did. I now stand in awe at the majesty of who Jesus is, a humbling reminder that He and He alone is -uniquely- the I AM, and I'm a sinner saved by His sacrifice and grace. This is HIS gift that He gave to me. Jesus is the Artist!

We did this in one nonstop shot with three camera angles. It took me four months of practice *every day* to get this right. This was done with black acrylic paint with my hands and a single Filbert size 16 brush on a 48x60 canvas. I still have a LOT to learn. This whole process was humbling and incredible to be a part of. 

I know I'll be accused of making a graven image just for painting this. I'd encourage people to look at those passages in the Old Testament and read what exactly a graven image is, then observe if that's indeed what's going on here. Here are some good articles about that:

What is a Graven Image? https://www.gotquestions.org/graven-image.html

Is it Wrong to Have pictures of Jesus? 
https://www.gotquestions.org/pictures-of-Jesus.html

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/NewAgeToChristianity/
Instagram: @melissaldougherty

title: Seed Droppers: Simple (But Very Effective!) Ways to Talk to a Jehovah's Witness About Jesus
description:
This is Part 6, and the last video of my Series About Jehovah's Witnesses. In this video, I give you some of my favorite, simple but powerful ways to show a Jehovah's Witness about the Deity of Jesus... by using their *own* Bible translation. I call these 'seed droppers' as they're quick, very effective, and are meant to leave quite the stone in their shoe and let the Holy Spirit do His thing. This is by far one of the *toughest* topics to talk about with a Jehovah's Witness which is why I waited to address it.

title: Mind Control: Entering Into the Mind of the Jehovah's Witness
description:
This is Part 2 of the Series. Jehovah's Witnesses are not like the atheist next door, the 'open-minded' New Ager or the typical unbeliever. It's paramount, in my opinion, to understand *why* they're so difficult to reach. So what's the 'secret sauce' to the Witnesses undying devotion to their Watchtower Organization?

Mind Control. 

Yes, it's a real thing. In this video, I break down why and how the Jw's are under spiritual and mental lockdown, and why it's so important to connect with them understanding this perspective. I refer to Steven Hassan's work on this. He's an ex-cult member, now a cult expert. I go over his BITE model: Behavior Control, Information Control, Thought Control, and Emotional Control.

title: Sharing Truth in Love: Encouragement and a Plea to Christians
description:
Let me get mushy for a second.

This is made in hopes that we can have some insight into how we look, sound, and act as the Body of Christ. I have found myself visiting the same set of Scriptures over the last few months, and I thought it would be an encouragement to all of us during a tough time, but also in hopes that we can all learn how to treat others as we would want to be treated. 

We're not going to be perfect. I'm definitely not! But I'd hope that we can remember that making our lights shine doesn't mean sacrificing good theology... or our ability to be kind. Especially to those we disagree with. 

The Scriptures are: 
2 Timothy 2:22-26
1 Peter 2:12
1 Peter 3:15
Colossians 4:6
James 1:19

title: A Critique of Kenneth Copeland's "Supernatural Heatwave" Video
description:
Come along on a journey with me... a journey through one of Kenneth Copeland's "sermons." I laughed. I cried. I cringed. I jest, but I've been wanting to talk about Kenneth Copeland for a while, and I decided this video was a good starting point to fairly critique his teachings. 

A lot of people don't actually believe that Kenneth Copeland teaches the things he does. Some think it was something he said once in the 80s that he can't possibly still teach. This is my attempt to give some thoughts on why his teachings are more theatrical than biblical, and why he should be avoided. Let's be sure to pray for him. 

I purposely didn't edit out a lot of the talk and the long pauses in between his sentences, simply for context and making the point of showing his speaking style. 

This was my first time doing a sort of screen share video and did have audio issues that hopefully don't come through too much. 

*Just a disclaimer- remember guys, it's easier to be a bully when it comes to putting someone down. It takes love and dignity to not stoop to such a level when we're disagreeing with someone like Kenneth Copeland... who- let's face it- can be an easy target. Let's display a godly maturity in this area ğŸ™

title: The Passion Translation: Encountering God?... Or Deception?
description:
There's SO much more to say about this topic. The Passion Translation is an independent, one-man 'translation' of the Bible. It's 'translated' by Brian Simmons, a respected figure in the hyper-charismatic community.  We talk a lot about him and his claimed credentials for translating the Passion Translation. This isn't a 'translation' so much as it is a re-worded and re-written Bible made to fit the theology and terminology used in what people have called the NAR- The New Apostolic Reformation. 

There's a lot more information on this listed below. Please consider further research on the origins of this Bible.

title: From New Age-Thought to Jesus: My Story Out of Deception
description:
I finally made a new video of my testimony. I liked the other one a lot, I just wasn't prepared for my channel to grow as it has in the last year, so I thought I'd update it. 

**NOTE: I didn't realize until I was editing this video that I look to the side a *lot* as I'm speaking. I wasn't reading notes or anything like that, but I notice that I look down and away from the camera when I'm in genuine thought. This was unintentional.
