title: The Meaning of Faith Without Works, and How We're Saved: Looking at James 2:14-26
description:
*Correction- at around the 26 mark, it's *Esther* without the works, nor Ruth. Oops.* 

Are we saved by faith alone, or faith plus works? This should be a very simple answer, but unfortunately, many works based religions have placed a yoke of works on people by using verses like James 2:26, and others, to tell them works are necessary for salvation. In this video, I look at the teachings, philosophy, and fallacies of works based religions vs grace alone, and go through James 2:14-16 and explain it. James wrote his letter for a reason. Let's take a look!

Follow on Social Media:
Instagram: @melissadougherty77
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/NewAgeToChristianity

Further Research:
CARM:https://carm.org/are-we-justified-faith-romans-or-works-james

STR: https://www.str.org/articles/faith-and-works-paul-vs.-james#.XgytTNZKjPA

Helpful Scriptures:

Rom. 3:24, "being justified as a gift by His grace through the redemption which is in Christ Jesus;"
Rom. 3:26, "for the demonstration, I say, of His righteousness at the present time, that He might be just and the justifier of the one who has faith in Jesus."
Rom. 3:28-30, "For we maintain that a man is justified by faith apart from works of the Law. 29Or is God the God of Jews only? Is He not the God of Gentiles also? Yes, of Gentiles also, 30since indeed God who will justify the circumcised by faith and the uncircumcised through faith is one."
Rom. 4:3, "For what does the Scripture say? "And Abraham believed God, and it was reckoned to him as righteousness."
Rom. 4:5, "But to the one who does not work, but believes in Him who justifies the ungodly, his faith is reckoned as righteousness,"
Rom. 4:11, "And he received the sign of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness of the faith which he had while still uncircumcised, that he might be the father of all those who believe, though they are uncircumcised, that righteousness might be imputed to them also,"
Rom. 4:16, "Therefore it is of faith that it might be according to grace, so that the promise might be sure to all the seed, not only to those who are of the law, but also to those who are of the faith of Abraham, who is the father of us all."
Rom. 5:1, "therefore having been justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ,"
Rom. 5:9, "Much more then, having now been justified by His blood, we shall be saved from the wrath of God through Him."
Rom. 9:30, "What shall we say then?  That Gentiles, who did not pursue righteousness, attained righteousness, even the righteousness which is by faith."
Rom. 9:33, "just as it is written, â€œBehold, I lay in Zion a stone of stumbling and a rock of offense, And he who believes in Him will not be disappointed.â€
Rom. 10:4, "For Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone who believes."
Rom. 10:9-10, "that if you confess with your mouth Jesus as Lord, and believe in your heart that God raised Him from the dead, you shall be saved;  10for with the heart man believes, resulting in righteousness, and with the mouth he confesses, resulting in salvation."
Rom. 11:6, "But if it is by grace, it is no longer on the basis of works, otherwise grace is no longer grace."
Gal. 2:16, "nevertheless knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the Law but through faith in Christ Jesus, even we have believed in Christ Jesus, that we may be justified by faith in Christ, and not by the works of the Law; since by the works of the Law shall no flesh be justified."
Gal. 2:21, â€œI do not nullify the grace of God; for if righteousness comes through the Law, then Christ died needlessly.â€
Gal.3:5-6, "Does He then, who provides you with the Spirit and works miracles among you, do it by the works of the Law, or by hearing with faith? 6Even so Abraham believed God, and it was reckoned to him as righteousness."
Gal. 3:8, "And the Scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the Gentiles by faith, preached the gospel beforehand to Abraham, saying, "All the nations shall be blessed in you."
Gal. 3:14, "in order that in Christ Jesus the blessing of Abraham might come to the Gentiles, so that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith."
Gal. 3:22, "But the Scripture has shut up all men under sin, that the promise by faith in Jesus Christ might be given to those who believe."
Gal. 3:24, "Therefore the Law has become our tutor to lead us to Christ, that we may be justified by faith."
Phil. 3:9, "and may be found in Him, not having a righteousness of my own derived from the Law, but that which is through faith in Christ, the righteousness which comes from God on the basis of faith."
1 Tim. 1:16, "And yet for this reason I found mercy, in order that in me as the foremost, Jesus Christ might demonstrate His perfect patience, as an example for those who would believe in Him for eternal life."

title: Are There Scriptures That Support New Age and Word of Faith? Talking with Pastor Mike Winger
description:
I got the great opportunity to talk with my friend and one of my favorite apologists on YouTube, Mike Winger, about how we can properly understand these scriptures taken out of context to support many teachings that we see in the Hyper-Charismatic, Word of Faith, and New Age movements. 

This is a follow up video from my Law of Attraction video that I did a few months ago. I addressed many things in the video, but a constant question I got asked as a result were what scriptures in particular were distorted to fit this type of teaching? We come to find that it's not just the Law of Attraction, or even new age/new thought in general, but also what we find in many of our churches today. There are a lot of scriptures that are used to support new age/new thought teachings. These are just a few, and the ones that I see mostly misused in churches and from new age/new thought teachers. 

If you haven't checked out Mike's YouTube channel, it has fantastic content on it that will definitely be a blessing to you as he has covered many relevant topics in Christianity.

I want to thank Mike for taking the time to do this video. I don't think we intended it to be as long as it ended up to be, but it will definitely be worth the time to watch. I learned a lot from this conversation, things that I needed to hear and learn too.

#apologetics #Jesusistheonlyway #salvation

title: Speed Painting of Jesus in 4 minutes!
description:
I'm practicing more speed painting! I want to transition to a larger canvas as soon as I get the hang of the smaller ones. It's so fun learning!

Some tips that I used to help me with this: a big one was that an artist friend of mine told me to use textured white paint to mark reference points of where I would need to use the black paint. It's put on beforehand. That is the key in me making this happen at this point in my artist Journey. Over time I hope to do it independently.

Follow on Instagram for Christian content and more art:

@melissadougherty77

Just a disclaimer: Please remember that this is a negative space painting. This is supposed to be black and white, and no color or race is implied. I understand Jesus was a Jewish middle easterner. I also know I'll be accused of making a graven image just for painting this. I'd encourage people to look at those passages in the old testament and read what *exactly a graven image is*, then observe if that's indeed what's going on here. Here's some good articles about that:

What is a Graven Image? https://www.gotquestions.org/graven-image.html

Is it Wrong to Have pictures if Jesus? 
https://www.gotquestions.org/pictures-of-Jesus.html

Gob Bless you!

title: Live Speed Painting of Jesus the Servant
description:
I always wanted to try a speed painting. I had NO idea how to do this in almost 6 minutes, and I admit halfway through I almost gave up. It was harder than I thought it'd be. I stepped back when I was done and thought... wow... that wasn't too bad!

I challenged myself and am happy I did. I've been wanting to do this piece to this song for a while now. The song is More of You by Kristian Stanfill.

Some tips that I used to help me with this: a big one was that an artist friend of mine told me to use textured white paint to mark reference points of where I would need to use the black paint. It's put on beforehand. That is the key in me making this happen at this point in my artist Journey. Over time I hope to do it independently.
